tn.text: This refers to the time when God punishes the wicked.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
Here "me" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: I will build you up again so you will be built
tn.text: AT: "I will make you strong again" or "I will make you prosper again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:18:13|18:13]].
musical instruments with heads like a drum that can be hit and with pieces of metal around their sides that sound when the instruments are shaken (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
AT: "Let everyone hear your praises" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the people still alive" (UDB)
Yahweh continues speaking.
"listen" or "pay attention"
Here "them" refers to the Israelite people.

tn.ref: I will be a father to Israel, and Ephraim will be my firstborn
tn.text: Here "Ephraim" is another name for "Israel." AT: "I will be like a father to the people of Israel, and they will be like my firstborn child" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The first born had special honor and responsibility.

tn.ref: The one who scattered Israel is gathering her up
tn.text: AT: "I caused my people to be scattered among the nations, but now I am bringing them home." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: as a shepherd keeps his sheep
tn.text: This means God cares for and protects his people as a shepherd does his sheep. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: For Yahweh has ransomed Jacob and has redeemed him from the hand that was too strong for him
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that it is Yahweh who has rescued the people of Israel. AT: "For Yahweh has rescued the people of Israel from their enemy who was too strong for them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means they will be strong and healthy, and they will prosper. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: they will never again feel any more sorrow
tn.text: This is an exaggeration of the joy Israel will have. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Here "I" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: My people will fill themselves with my goodness
tn.text: "My goodness will satisfy my people"

tn.ref: A voice is heard in Ramah
tn.text: AT: "I hear a voice in Ramah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: It is Rachel weeping for her children
tn.text: Here "Rachael" refers to the women of Israel who are crying over their children. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: She refuses to be comforted over them, for they live no longer
tn.text: AT: "She will not let anyone comfort her, for her children are dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You punished me, and I have been punished
tn.text: The repetition of the phrase indicates either the severity of Yahweh's punishment or the effectiveness of it. AT: "You punished me severely" (UDB) or "You punished me, and I have learned from that punishment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Bring me back like an untrained calf
tn.text: Ephraim is asking for God to make him teachable as an untrained calf. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The words "ashamed" and "humiliated" mean basically the same thing and intensify the idea of shame. AT: "I was completely ashamed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Is not Ephraim my precious child? Is he not my dear, delightful son?
tn.text: AT: "Ephraim is my precious child. He is my dear, delightful son. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
God continues to speak from verse 7.

tn.ref: Place road signs ... Set up guideposts ... Set your mind ... Come back
tn.text: These commands are addressed to "virgin Israel."

tn.ref: Set your mind on the right path, the way you should take.
tn.text: AT: "Try hard to remember the way you came when you were taken into captivity." (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
God is referring to a changed Israel. (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: How long will you continue to waver, faithless daughter?
tn.text: God is asking how long His people will disobey Him. AT: "Do not hesitate to start obeying me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Here this refers to the people of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: May Yahweh bless you, you righteous place where he lives, you holy mountain.
tn.text: Jerusalem is on the top of a hill, and the temple was built at the highest point in Jerusalem. AT; "May Yahweh bless those who live in Jerusalem with Yahweh, where his temple is." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will sow the houses of Israel and Judah with the descendants of man and beast
tn.text: "I will increase man and beast like a farmer plants crops" or "I will increase the populations of both people and animals in the kingdoms of Israel and Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I kept them under surveillance in order to uproot them
tn.text: "looked for ways to uproot them"
See how you translated these ideas in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:09|1:9]].
"Listen" or "pay attention to what I am going to tell you."
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: I will place my law within them and will write it on their heart
tn.text: These two phrases have similar meanings and emphasize that Yahweh's law will become a part of them, rather than merely written on stone. Here "heart" represents "emotions" or "mind." AT: "My law will be part of their thoughts and emotions." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: from the smallest of them to the greatest
tn.text: This phrase refers to every person, regardless of their importance in society. AT: "every single one of them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
These phrase refer to the whole of creation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
"Pay attention! What I am about to talk about will happen soon."

tn.ref: Tower of Hananel ... Corner Gate ... hill of Gareb ... Goah ... Kidron Valley ... Horse Gate
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"made holy"
